title: How Sweet, How Heavenly Is The Sight
author: Joseph Swain (1761-1796)

v1: How sweet, how heav'nly is the sight,
When those who love the Lord
v2: When each can feel his brother's sigh,
And with him bear a part;
When sorrow flows from eye to eye,
And joy from heart to heart.
v3: When, free from envy, scorn and pride,
Each can his brother's failings hide,
v4: When love, in one delightful stream,
When union sweet, and dear esteem,
v5: Love is the golden chain that binds;
The saints Thy grace thus prove.
And he is glory's heir that finds
